Inactive Projects: This places all associated Tasks on hold. No work will be able to continue for any task. This is useful if you have a temporary stop work order.

Technicians listed here are temporarily unavailable for work. For example, they may be on vacation.
Click on any Location to select : Right click to edit

Locations listed here cannot be used in Tasks. However, it may be helpful to continue to track their coordinates. There may also be data collected at the Location, but the Location is out of service, for example, an abandoned well.

Add Locations here. Type in Location names, separated by a carriage return. A list of Locations can also be copied from files like Word or Excel. If the coordinates are known, include the latitue and longitude on the same line as the Location name, separated by commas.
Right click on an Active Task to view the Task progress. You can also communicate with Technicians and Service Providers once the Task has been activated.

This column is for Tasks that are 'Under Construction'. Do not activate Tasks until they are completely prepared. Once Tasks are activated, they cannot be edited, and inactivating a Task stops all work in progress.
The Task will not start unless you click the 'Begin Work' button in the active Task view.
This allows Tasks to be initiated by an external trigger, like and alarm. Not currently functional.
